definition: to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: Music educates people to be harmonious; from here we can see the grace of life.
sentences.chinese: 因乐教而使性情谐和安乐，此见生命之优美。

sentences.english: They'd started usin' harmonic drills in their mines. The stone was unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 他们在矿井里用谐和钻孔机，让石头不高兴了。

sentences.english: They'd started using' harmonic drills in their mines. The stone was unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 他们在矿井里用谐和钻孔机，让石头不高兴了。

sentences.english: The toxins came from discordant technology similar to present time technology and waste.
sentences.chinese: 毒素来自不谐和的科技，类似于当代科技和废料。

definition: modulation (rising and falling pitch)/intonation/a cadence/to rise and fall (of a body floating in water)
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
same tone/in agreement with/homology (invariant of a topological space in math.)
string of pearl and jade (idiom); ideal combination/perfect pair
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to blend into one another/to blend together well
